Kernels for Graph Data¶

Kernels on Graph¶

pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.VNDKernel(A, alpha=0.5)[source]¶

Von Neumann Diffusion Kernel on graph (Zhou et al., 2004) (also label spreading kernel)

K = (I - alpha*S)^-1, where S = D^-1/2*A*D^-1/2

Parameters:
  • A – adjacency matrix
  • alpha – (hyper)parameter(s)
pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.cosKernel(A)[source]¶

Cosine Kernel (also Inverse Cosine Kernel)

K = cos (L*pi/4), where L is the normalized Laplacian

Parameters:A – adjacency matrix
pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.diffKernel(A, beta=0.5)[source]¶

Diffusion Process Kernel

K = exp(beta * H), where H = -L = A-D

K = Q exp(beta * Lambda) Q.T

Parameters:
  • A – adjacency matrix
  • beta – (hyper)parameter(s)
pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.normLap(A)[source]¶

normalized Laplacian

pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.psInvLapKernel(A)[source]¶

Pseudo inverse of the normalized Laplacian.

Parameters:A – adjacency matrix
pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.regLapKernel(A, sigma=1)[source]¶

Regularized Laplacian Kernel

Parameters:
  • A – adjacency matrix
  • sigma – (hyper)parameter(s)
pyGPs.GraphStuff.kernels_on_graph.rwKernel(A, p=1, a=2)[source]¶

p-step Random Walk Kernel with a>1

K = (aI-L)^p, p>1 and L is the normalized Laplacian

Parameters:
  • A – adjacency matrix
  • p – step parameter
  • a – (hyper)parameter(s)

tbd.
